Package ohos.ai.tts

Class TtsClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ai.tts.TtsClient

  • public class TtsClient
extends Object
    Provides methods for invoking the text to speech (TTS) engine service.

    The methods include speakText(java.lang.String,java.lang.String), speakLongText(java.lang.String,java.lang.String), and stopSpeak().

    Since:
    3

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TtsClient getInstance​()
        Returns a singleton instance of TtsClient.

        If there is a TtsClient object, this method will return it to the caller. If there is no TtsClient object, this method will create one and return it to the caller.

        Returns:
        Returns the singleton instance of TtsClient.
        Since:
        3

      • create

        public void create​(Context context,
                   TtsListener ttsListener)
        Creates a TTS client.

        You can obtain the creation result (success or failure) from TtsListener#onEvent(int, PacMap).

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context. This parameter cannot be null.
        ttsListener - Indicates the listener for observing the TTS callback process and result. You are not advised to set this parameter to null because the null value will cause a failure to obtain the execution status of methods in this class.
        Since:
        3

      • release

        public void release​()
        Releases the TTS engine in use.

        Calling this method will set the initialization status to false and stop the ongoing speaking task. Therefore, you are advised to use this method before calling init(ohos.ai.tts.TtsParams).

        Since:
        3

      • init

        public boolean init​(TtsParams ttsParams)
        Initializes the TTS client.

        You can set the device ID, device type, speaking speed, volume, pitch, and timbre in the input parameter ttsParams. Among them, the device ID is mandatory. If it is not set, the initialization will fail.

        Parameters:
        ttsParams - Indicates initialization parameters, including the following fields:
        • Device ID: length from 1 to 64 (all spaces are not allowed to form a device ID).
        • Device type: an integer ranging from 0 (default value) to 4. 0 represents a mobile phone,1 for a speaker, 2 for a web-based device,3 for a tablet, and 4 for a large screen.
        • Speaking speed: an integer ranging from 0 to 15, with 5 as the default value
          • Volume: an integer ranging from 0 to 15, with 11 as the default valuePitch: an integer ranging from 0 to 15, with 5 as the default value
        • Timbre: 0 for SPEAKER_XIAOYI and 1 for SPEAKER_YOYO, with 0 as the default value

        If the value for any of these fields is incorrect, the TTS engine will fail to be initialized.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the initialization is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setParams

        public boolean setParams​(TtsParams ttsParams)
        Sets TTS parameters.

        You can use this method to modify the speaking volume, pitch, speed, and timbre in ttsParams. You are advised to use this method after you have called init(ohos.ai.tts.TtsParams).

        Parameters:
        ttsParams - Indicates TTS parameters (speaking volume, pitch, speed, and timbre, each ranging from 0 to 15).

        If any of these parameters is invalid, the parameter settings will fail; if other parameters (device ID and device type) are passed to this method without verification, the parameters will not be used even if the settings are successful. Instead, the TTS engine will use the parameters (device ID and device type) in the init(ohos.ai.tts.TtsParams) method.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setAudioType

        public boolean setAudioType​(AudioManager.AudioVolumeType audioType)
        Sets the audio stream type.

        You can call this method before enabling audio speaking.

        Parameters:
        audioType - Indicates the audio stream type. Currently, the following types are supported:
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_MUSIC (default value)
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_VOICE_CALL
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_SYSTEM
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_RING
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_NOTIFICATION
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_ALARM
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_DTMF
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_TTS
        • AudioManager.AudioVolumeType.STREAM_ACCESSIBILITY
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • speakText

        public void speakText​(String text,
                      String utteranceId)
        Synthesizes text into audio and starts speaking.
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to speak. The maximum text length is 512. If the length exceeds 512 or the text is empty, an error occurs and is passed in TtsListener#onError(String, String) to the caller.
        utteranceId - Uniquely identifies a speaking request. If this parameter is null or an empty string, the TTS engine randomly generates a value for this parameter.
        Since:
        3

      • speakLongText

        public void speakLongText​(String longText,
                          String utteranceId)
        Synthesizes long text into audio and starts speaking.

        This method is an enhancement of speakText(java.lang.String,java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        longText - Indicates the long text to speak. The maximum length for long text is 100000. If the length exceeds 100000 or the text is empty, an error occurs and is passed in TtsListener#onError(String, String) to the caller.
        utteranceId - Uniquely identifies a speaking request. If this parameter is null or an empty string, the TTS engine randomly generates a value for this parameter.
        Since:
        3

      • isSpeaking

        public boolean isSpeaking​()
        Checks whether TTS speaking is in progress.
        Returns:
        Returns true if TTS speaking is in progress; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • stopSpeak

        public void stopSpeak​()
        Stops TTS speaking.

        If a TTS task stopped by this method is restarted, speaking starts from the beginning instead of where the previous speaking stopped.

        Since:
        3

      • getVersion

        public Optional<String> getVersion​()
        Obtains the version of TTS software development kit (SDK).
        Returns:
        Returns the SDK version number encapsulated by Optional. You can call the get method in Optional to obtain the SDK version number represented by a string.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Optional

      • destroy

        public void destroy​()
        Destroys the TTS client.

        You must use this method after all ongoing TTS tasks are complete.

        Since:
        3
